message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the geography and terminology associated with mountains. Mt. Everest is the highest peak in the world, so if someone were to "get high" at Mt. Everest, it would mean that they have reached the summit or apex of the mountain. Option (A) is incorrect because it refers to arriving at an airport, which is not related to getting high on a mountain. Option (B) is also incorrect because it refers to waiting for cabs, which is unrelated to mountain climbing. Option (C) is incorrect because it refers to being at the bottom of the mountain, which is the opposite of getting high or reaching the summit.
